screenshots.description: Chiseled Armor pieces render chiseled blocks (and any items) as their moving parts.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor

screenshots.description: After you have created your model around the in-world bodypart template area, put the armor piece in 'Block Collection' mode. Clicking one block/bit and releasing on another, draws a box around your model and imports copies of all intersecting blocks.
screenshots.title: Step 2 - Block Collection

screenshots.description: Remove spherical areas of bits from clicked chiseled/chiselable blocks.
screenshots.title: After Local Spherical Bit Removal

screenshots.description: Example of a 1:1 scale brick helmet with gold horns.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Helmet

screenshots.description: Model of a village made with the Modeling Tool by reading the village chunk by chunk (24 chunks in total).
screenshots.title: Village Model

screenshots.description: Cuboid created with drawn mode. Local/global mode shape is a cube.
screenshots.title: Cuboid

screenshots.description: Rotate chiseled blocks.
screenshots.title: Rotate

screenshots.description: Invert chiseled blocks.
screenshots.title: Invert

screenshots.description: Ellipsoid created with drawn mode. Local/global mode shape is a ellipse.
screenshots.title: Ellipsoid

screenshots.description: Example where chiseled wool blocks are rendered at 1:1, such that they effectively re-texture the player.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Textured Body

screenshots.description: Example of a Chiseled Armor moving part preventing a moving part of the player model from rendering.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Peg Leg

screenshots.description: Mirror chiseled blocks.
screenshots.title: Mirror

screenshots.description: Click a surface in 'Template Creation' mode to set an area that represents the bodypart associated with the armor piece's selected moving part at the selected scale (right-click to additionally fill the area with bits that will be ignored when importing).
screenshots.title: Step 1 - Bodypart Template Creation

screenshots.description: A village that was read, chunk by chunk (24 chunks in total), with the Modeling Tool to make a model of it.
screenshots.title: Village

screenshots.description: Holding the Chisels & Bits radial menu key (default is Left Alt, i.e. 'LMENU') with a tool in-hand will open a menu GUI for changing all tool settings. This is an alternate means of changing settings from the key/mouse combinations.
screenshots.title: Bit Tool Settings Menu

screenshots.description: A spherical chamber made with a Sculpting Wires by removing a spherical area of bits in global mode.
screenshots.title: Outside Spherical Chamber

screenshots.description: Armor worn in one of the added inventory vanity slots render on the player, but don't take up an armor slot and don't provide additional protection. Click the helmet icon (if displayed) in the survival player inventory or press H (by default) to access.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Vanity Slots GUI

screenshots.description: An eye made with Sculpting Wires and Spades by removing/adding spherical areas of bits in global mode.
screenshots.title: Jungle Temple Eye

screenshots.description: This is the default model rendered for Chiseled Armor when it has not been set to render any items for any of its moving parts.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Default Model

screenshots.description: Example where a collection of blocks are rendered at 1:2 scale as the player's head.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Head

screenshots.description: A spherical chamber made with a Sculpting Wires by removing a spherical area of bits in global mode.
screenshots.title: Inside Spherical Chamber

screenshots.description: Elliptic cylinder created with drawn mode. Local/global mode shape is a circular cylinder.
screenshots.title: Elliptic Cylinder

screenshots.description: Example where a tree of gold/diamond in a large wooden box is rendered at 1:2 scale as a hat.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Tree Large

screenshots.description: Example where chiseled blocks of flowing water/lava are rendered at a very small scale to give the player animated eyes.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Eyes

screenshots.description: The sculpting shapes of spades can be offset for placement.
screenshots.title: Offset Shape

screenshots.description: Remove spherical areas if bits from clicked chiseled/chiselable blocks.
screenshots.title: Before Local Spherical Bit Removal

screenshots.description: Example where a tree and some grass below it are rendered at small scale as a hat.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor Tree Small

screenshots.description: All data of all currently worn armor pieces can be viewed and modified in the GUI. There, any item can be added/removed and can have any number of GL operations (rotation, translation, scale) applied to it. Open with G for normal and SHIFT + G for vanity.
screenshots.title: Chiseled Armor GUI

screenshots.description: GUI for manually mapping states and blocks to bits for use in the Modeling Tool.
screenshots.title: Bit Mapping GUI

screenshots.description: Elliptic cone created with drawn mode. Local/global mode shape is a circular cone.
screenshots.title: Elliptic Cone

screenshots.description: Translate chiseled blocks.
screenshots.title: Translate

screenshots.description: Rectangular pyramid created with drawn mode. Local/global mode shape is a square pyramid.
screenshots.title: Rectangular Pyramid

summary: Adds extra in-world bit manipulation to the Chisels & Bits mod.
name: Extra Bit Manipulation
